page.title: 17Customs + Crafts: Middleton
page.content: A Well dressing is done each year during the third week in May. This is a thanksgiving for the gift of pure water. It is a picture in an elaborate border depicted in flower petals, leaves and moss on clay. It takes a week to make, is unveiled early on a Saturday morning and then is left on display for a week for all to enjoy. Mischief night is on Halloween when the children bang the door knockers, remove gates and have an evening of pranks. A craft workshop was held weekly for three months in the Village Hall to bring together people of all ages. The items produced were sold at the annual village market, the garden fete with Youlgrave and a garden fete in the village for "Save the Children" fund.
